meanings.definition: A situation or condition in which there is no movement or activity.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the town came to a standstill as everyone stayed indoors.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam brought the city to a standstill, causing delays for hours.
meanings.sent3: The standstill in the classroom was broken by the sudden sound of the bell.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to come to a standstill when she saw the surprise waiting for her.
meanings.sent5: The standstill in the forest was so quiet, you could hear a pin drop.

meanings.sent1: The sudden standstill of the train surprised all the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The standstill at the intersection made it difficult for pedestrians to cross.
meanings.sent3: The standstill in the movie was so unexpected, it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind came to a standstill as he tried to process the shocking news.
meanings.sent5: The standstill of time in the painting captured a moment of pure beauty.
